Nagoya protocol restrictions and complia: no known restrictions under the Nagoya protocol
History: IHEM, 1988 < B, 1987 < CBS, 1951 < ATCC < QM < C. Thom, USDA
Applications: fungus resistance testing (U.S. federal and military specifications); testing of aerosols (J. Pharm. Sci. 55: 1471-1472, 1966); produces cellulase, ß-1,4- glucan -4- glucanohydrolase (Mater. Org. (Berl.) 7: 27-43, 1972); fungus resistance testing of: paper and paperboard (ASTM Std. D2020-76), polymers (ASTM Std. G21-80), plastics (Int. Std ISO 846-1978(E)) and textiles (Brit. Std. BS 6085: 1981); slimicide evaluation (ASTM Std. E599-89)
